website_summaries.verdict: While on the lightweight side in terms of capacity, this is a solid jack at an affordable price.
pros: Bolt-on jack that has a 1,000-pound weight capacity
Features a poly-hard wheel and 3/8-inch swivel pull pin
Stands 13 inches retracted, 23 inches extended (10 inches total travel distance)
cons: Corrosion-resistant zinc finish is on the thin side
Some buyers report that the gears seize up within a few months

customer_reviews.title: Great Swivel Tongue Jack. Easy Install, All Hardware, Smooth Operation.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. So far it works great. Smooth operation, fairly quick to lower and raise with a comfortable handle right out of the box. Came with all mounting hardware, which the description probably said, and I assumed, but the winch I also bought with it didn't come with any hardware so I was worried. Installed easy on 16' Continental trailer. Helps me move a 14' Panga around easily and attach a hitch solo now. Will update the review if it seems to corrode quicker than acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: E. Raslich

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this tongue jack to put on a boat trailer to haul my kayak. The trailer was overkill, but way less expensive than the fancy kayak trailers! This tongue jack was easy to install, included the hardware, (yes, some local stores were selling it w/out hardware - had to buy it for more $$!) and it does the job for me. Easy to roll around in the grass and on blacktop, wheel locks in place when up and down, and I can adjust the height with ease. Read many reviews before I ordered it and decided there were more pro reviews than con ones. Add mine to the pro list!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than Cabelas
customer_reviews.text: I had bought one at Cabelas but it sucked so I returned it and got this one. My friend installed it. If you extend it all the way and push the boat I feel like it will bend and go out of alignment so I am careful to have the boat at a low angle if I am going to push it. I have to have it fully extended plus some to get onto my hitch so I have to do a little more work than usual to hook up. I could change the hitch but it's set for another trailer and rv. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Travelbuzz

customer_reviews.title: Made my life easy at 68
customer_reviews.text: I attached this jack to my 16' boat trailer by myself and had no trouble. I was replacing a 12" jack which had been on the trailer for at least 25 years. About 1 month ago I pulled my back muscle taking the trailor off a couple of cinder blocks and was in pain for 3 weeks. It was very easy to elevate the front of the boat. I wish that I had installed this 24" jack long ago. I am pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: readytoretire

customer_reviews.title: Very good small trailer jack.
customer_reviews.text: WOW after reading some negative reviews I was surprised at how heavy duty it really is. My trailer loves it and I love it. So easy to install and works so good. Of course it would not work on our travel trailer but just right for our utility trailer. I recommend it for any small trailer.
customer_reviews.author: A. D (FUZZY) Barron

customer_reviews.title: I love this jack!
customer_reviews.text: Saved me the aggravation of having to move my trailer around in my garage by lifting it the whole time while moving it. I have to back my trailer into the two car garage stall and swing it around by hand to put it into the single car stall since it won’t fit through the single car stall door. This wheel is AWESOME!!! Hardly any effort needed to move it now!
customer_reviews.author: ma4kayla

customer_reviews.title: Good light-duty tongue jack
customer_reviews.text: I got this tongue jack to replace the old, beat up one that came on my used Triton snowmobile trailer when I bought it. It was easy to install and came greased and ready to go. It lifts smoothly and the rotation function is smooth. The wheel has a sleeve in the axle so it seems like it will allow easy moving of the trailer. It remains to be seen whether it will stand up to the salty road spray, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Medium quality
customer_reviews.text: I have had this on my utility trailer for about 6 months. It raises and lowers with no problem. It would be nice if the handle could be secured. I use a bungee cord which works fine. The caster seems a bit flimsy but it has not failed yet. I greased it for the first time last week and the nipple to accept the grease gun broke off in my grease gun. I'm not sure if that can be replaced. Overall it has be fine in terms of functionality. I think I will look elsewhere for my next trailer jack.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ricks

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for my shorelander trailer.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my shorelander boat trailer. But mounting braket must be disassembled from jack by removing snap ring. You also need to keep mounting hardware from old jack because it is not included. Removing old jack was not an easy task. Rusted bolts were very hard to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Ramos

customer_reviews.title: and I love it. I can wheel it on cement very ...
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my jetski trailer, and I love it. I can wheel it on cement very easily by myself. It's more difficult but I can still wheel it through the small gravel in my driveway as well. Seems very durable. Easy to install on a 3" trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: High quality part
customer_reviews.text: I needed a decent jack for my snowmobile trailer and this fits the bill, it is sturdy though I really wish it had another 4in of height to lift (about 2in too short I have to lift it onto the hitch). Still for the price it is a great value and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: MRM

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I put this on the front of my 18' boat trailer. I'm afraid to try to roll the trailer around on this jack because it looks like it's going to collapse. Making things worse is that it ends up angled one way or another so that the wheel doesn't want to pivot.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie D

customer_reviews.title: This is my second jack from this Co.  I give it 3 stars because...
customer_reviews.text: If you ever find yourself at a shallow boat ramp and have to back in to the point this jack sees salt water it will rust and freeze up inside in a few months. There is no way to take it apart, add extra grease, wash out the internal screw with fresh water, etc. For the $ it is a good jack but don't submerge it in salt water or you'll be replacing it in no time (as I am).
customer_reviews.author: Deepsea21

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace the jack on my boat trailer and this one was a perfect fit. I used the existing mounting plate on the trailer and took this one off at the snap ring to attach it to my trailer. Was a pretty quick install because of this. It goes up and down pretty easy and seems to be sturdy enough for my avg sized boat. i would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: Easy install and perfect fit to oem. Great for snap ring install as used in my shorelander trailer. 20 minutes and only takes that long as the whole winch assembly has to be taken off of trailer to get access to mounting bolts.
customer_reviews.author: huge

customer_reviews.title: Failed after on season,
customer_reviews.text: IT looks like a well-built unit but seems to have a critical flaw. The weal assembly is fixed to the trailer mounting plate but a simple snap ring. This broke. resulting in the wheel jack separating off the mounting bracket attached to the trailer one half of snap ring fell off also, do not know where the other half went. Lucky it was attached to the truck when it happened. This was after one season.
customer_reviews.author: tundra

customer_reviews.title: Good buy...with a small problem.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like the quality of these...but in the Florida saltwater, I had the swivel wheel rust up...it took a bit to break it free, but it seems to be okay now. I would probably buy these again....
customer_reviews.author: AMNSBFL

customer_reviews.title: Works good!
customer_reviews.text: Surdy enough for my RTT utility trailer. I do wish that it had a rubberized layer on the wheel, but that's not a big deal. I love how quick and easy it is to fold out of they way, my wife can even do it!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, especially if you have 2 people. My GMC Terrain's hitch is a bit low, so I actually have to lift the trailer a bit to get the wheel on the Jack to extend down fully and lock. Not a big problem. Fine quality. Also, the handle hangs down, so the plastic gets pitted by gravel pretty quickly and easily. I solved that by holding it up with a bungee cord. Also, not a big problem. Good packaging, deliver, and so far - quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tom M.

customer_reviews.title: Trailer jack with wheel
customer_reviews.text: Excellent purchase for the replacement of my 17 year old Coleman trailer tongue jack. It fit the original, welded on, plate. The hole in the new jack is exactly the same size and the lock pin holes line up perfectly. The original jack was load rated at 500 pounds so this 1000 pound jack should hold up better, 18 years or more I hope. The crank handle is "side mounted" and I hope it will not droop down while driving. I'll have to check it on my next trip and possibly find a way to strap it to the jack body. This is a minor concern.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice addition to my boat trailer as the old hydraulic jack gave out. It is smooth while raising and lowering the trailer. The only problem I had was the plastic grip handle fell off while going down the road on my first trip. My fault for not checking the tightness but customer service was easy and fast with a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Slick
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the factory tongue jack on my pace american utility trailer. It's 10x better than most factory tongue jacks in that you can fold it back so it doesn't catch on anything. It seems every non-folding tongue jack I see is bent. I was able to install this in about 10 minutes with a wrench and a socket driver, no extra parts or drilling required. I see some lower ratings based solely on the fact that it's made in China, which I find a little useless. This is a good product and it's very inexpensive; if you want american made stuff, prepare to pay more for the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: CV

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Bought this to replace the one on my boat trailer. Just a little skiff. This jack lasted me maybe 15 times. You can barely jack it up now. Handle won't even turn. And it doesn't go high at all. I took it off and spend the extra 15 bucks on a good one locally.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: See ya black cap!
customer_reviews.text: Overall pretty good. But, within first week of having this the black cap popped off the top of the main support shaft. Luckily I found it on the side of my driveway a week latter. I don't expect to have it stay in place throughout its life. But, it is cheap, does the job. Other than the black cap issue would give 5 stars for performance and price.
customer_reviews.author: COHwy9

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I do this sooner
customer_reviews.text: Installation took 20 minutes. I struggled with the old broken tongue jack for years. This jack is sturdy and so easy to rotate once the trailer is hitched, Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Anderson MD

customer_reviews.title: This unit does not function as advertised.  It is very weak.
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend this product. When I put this on my trailer, it bends! The weight rating says it will support my trailer weight, but it is suspect at best.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Ringo

customer_reviews.title: Easy pushing.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I only had to reverse the bolts for the clamp because of where I had to install it on the tongue of the trailer. Not hard to do.eas
customer_reviews.author: Taz bear

customer_reviews.title: Works ..heavy..I reccomend
customer_reviews.text: Nice a heavy and worked great on our boat trailer very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement
customer_reviews.text: Borrowed a friends trailer to haul a boat and broke the swivel. Ordered this as a replacement and my friend loved it. He said it was way better than the one he had on it before.
customer_reviews.author: singleton

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE Locked up after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: locked up garbage bought htis less than 4 months ago. went ot use the other day and NOTHING locked i opened the top and saw plenty of lube doetn look rusted or abused just frozen. what a piece of crap !! garbage waste of money and tine
customer_reviews.author: keith fuchs

customer_reviews.title: its a great universal jack
customer_reviews.text: Cant believe i waited so long to get one of these. Been busting a gut lifting my trailer off the hitch for years now and with a loaded trailer it wasnt always possible. For the money, its a great universal jack
customer_reviews.author: duke

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this for my brother-in-law's utility trailer and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my brother-in-law's utility trailer and it worked well. Later I purchased what I thought was a similar jack from HF. The HF jack does not have a zerk fitting for greasing and feels flimsy at full extension. If I could do it over, I would have bought another one of these vice the HF jack.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: It is not very sturdy when extended
customer_reviews.text: I only have a 12' aluminum boat and this is not sturdy cranking it up past 50%. I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl C.

customer_reviews.title: It'll work
customer_reviews.text: Had issues with width of bolt holes had to ream hole a bit for bolt to clear channel iron to bolt to back plate. Just a fraction of an inch might be channel iron is galvanized being a boat trailer. Thumbs up on the grease fitting.
customer_reviews.author: doroteo valdes

customer_reviews.title: Good Kit
customer_reviews.text: Good kit. Could have got it a little cheaper at tractor supply but I like Amazon shipping and needed one fast.
customer_reviews.author: John Hollis

customer_reviews.title: Oh my back!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my back is officially saved! Love this contraption! Can easily push around my 5x8 trailer instead of "carrying" it
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: "PRO SERIES"?!?!?!?!? Unethical, Misleading Product Claim. JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst jack I've ever bought. Lasted less than 5 months before the gears inside seized up. I had this on a Sea Doo trailer with a tongue weight of less than 250 lbs. The jack started corroding on the surface within 4 weeks, and I had to keep greasing it monthly to operate before it finally died. Complete waste of money and time. However, kudos to Amazon for refunding my money after 5 months so I can find a better quality jack.
customer_reviews.author: HarborHopper

customer_reviews.title: Solid Jack - Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: Using my boat in saltwater, things rust, even though I am diligent about washing the boat and trailer down thoroughly after each outing. This Swivel Trailer Jack went on easily on my 4" Frame (and has holes to fit larger frames) and works beautifully. It seems well constructed of a "corrosion resistant" metal, and hopefully will last another 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Harold M. Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: Decent price, decent product. If you have a 4" tongue just make sure that you position the mounting bracket correctly with the two holes on the plate on the bottom so you can install in correctly the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Trailer toung
customer_reviews.text: We installed this on our kayak trailer. This makes moving it around so much easier
customer_reviews.author: katyck

customer_reviews.title: May work for tongue weights of 30# or less
customer_reviews.text: Definitely on the lower end of trailer tongue swivels. With any weight on the wheel, it will not swivel and has to be kicked into position. Also, the clamp assembly for attaching to trailer tongue is very weak and doesn't stay in position, even when all bolts are torqued to the point of bending the metal.
customer_reviews.author: Kingkongmegatron

customer_reviews.title: Height
customer_reviews.text: The top height after cranking it up could have been slightly higher. I have a stock chevy silverado truck, and I had to place this jack way back on the tongue of the trailer in order to raise it just above the ball hitch. In uneven ground, I may have to lift it slightly by hand due to the height difference. However, still a good buy for my snowmobile trailer and cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Sean F Early

customer_reviews.title: steel strong enough?
customer_reviews.text: The long bolts bend under weight when attached to the trailer. just sayin'
customer_reviews.author: Conrad Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Just as advertised. Works well for my utility trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S Paulin

customer_reviews.title: Works good for dads trailer.
customer_reviews.text: Works good my my dads little trailer ge likes it a lot good Father's Day gift and good price.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Rejsek

customer_reviews.title: Built strong
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several over the years, but this is the most heavy duty. Built strong. Well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: G Abraham

customer_reviews.title: 120 pound Jon boat 160 pound trailer
customer_reviews.text: Bought October 9th 2019, broke off while moving about 5 feet to attach to car on my driveway. Very poor quality and awful welding of pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent G Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: Replaced our old worn jack with this one. Seems of the same quality and finish.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable value
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price but I question the 1000 pound capacity. I had a Bulldog on my last motorcycle trailer. No complaints great price and fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Sabo

customer_reviews.title: Wow this is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Makes transport 1000 times easier and it fold up when you need to trailor. Easy install!
customer_reviews.author: Barry G

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: easy to install and very smooth, grease adapter is a nice touch
customer_reviews.author: Joe Hill

customer_reviews.title: An old gal's salvation.
customer_reviews.text: I am 70 years old and have a utility trailer I use to haul my grain and hay for my horse. As the years have gone by I have had more and more difficulty lifting the tongue of my trailer as the bed is reinforced with plywood making it quite heavy. This Tongue Jack has given me more years to be able to move and work with my trailer. Takes all the weight off me when I hitch to my truck. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid Jack But Cheap Hardware
customer_reviews.text: The jack is solid but the metric nuts and bolts supplied can't handle much torque on install. I had to adjust and couldn't remove the nut because the threads had bent up in such a way that the nut kept spinning on the same place on the bolt without moving further off.
customer_reviews.author: Cody J Mathis

customer_reviews.title: Nice product - use caution handling it.
customer_reviews.text: This trailer jack was used in a boat trailer with 150 lbs if tongue weight. Seems to be working out very well as far as sturdiness and mechanical operation. One word of caution - use gloves or be very careful installing the base as it has sharp edges.
customer_reviews.author: joseph yannick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Best trailer swivel i have ever owned by far. Ive bought plenty of cheaper ones but this is definitely worth the money. Operates very smoothly. Used on a waverunner trailer and articulates perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Rken

customer_reviews.title: Slight lean
customer_reviews.text: Love the jack. Go low enough to get the wheel down on uneven surfaces. Wheel turns great on hard surfaces. Would have been 5 stars but once installed it has an inward lean to it. Not bad but noticeable. Worth spending more money to get the quality jack
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect for my needs. Super easy to install. Excellent product. Excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: Scottie

customer_reviews.title: that is recommended for a 3'' min size frame
customer_reviews.text: I bought this jack for my single jetski trailer. I didn't realized until I received it, that is recommended for a 3'' min size frame. My frame is 2.5". The jack and hardware are robust enough that I was able to install it with minor adjustments. I recommend to have someone help you to make the installation a bit easier and faster.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but it looks better than it performs
customer_reviews.text: Seems like high quality equipment. I will comment further as I use it taking my boat to the lake this summer. Update: It's a bit wobbly on it's pivot and when cranking. Tolerable.
customer_reviews.author: dbeasleyphx

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly easy to install. Definitely not a novice, but I was impressed with the simplicity and ease of operation. Much happier than the original jack that broke.
customer_reviews.author: Camryn Bell

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The jack rocks when trying to move the trailer while using the jack wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba

customer_reviews.title: Pro Series 1000 Lbs. Capacity Swivel Trailer Tongue Jack
customer_reviews.text: tongue jack arrived in like 1.5 days. installed easily, and is made of decent quality. Will see how it stands up over time to saltwater use, but even if it doesn't last as long, I can buy 3 of these for the price of the others. I think with wash downs and maintanance, this will work great.
customer_reviews.author: U.S. Paratrooper

customer_reviews.title: Wheel is very sturdy, as well as the rest
customer_reviews.text: Just got it! Looks well made. Wheel is very sturdy, as well as the rest.. My BF installed it for me.. Have not used it yet. I got it because it was a bit difficult for me to pull and align trailer and get it on the 4Runner.. I figure i can now do this myself without asking for help every time to put on/take off.. Will write more on my use, later!
customer_reviews.author: Booter

customer_reviews.title: great quality jack love the fact that it has a ...
customer_reviews.text: great quality jack love the fact that it has a zero fitting to allow you to easily maintain it with grease
customer_reviews.author: Thomas T.

customer_reviews.title: Small boat or PWC focused it would seem.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well however not as heavy duty as I expected. Mounting was easy and the hardware included worked as expected.
customer_reviews.author: DMF

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we were looking for and so easy to replace the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Have heard it's all good and works like it should
customer_reviews.text: Picked up as a gift for a friend. Have heard it's all good and works like it should.
customer_reviews.author: mh

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in may 2019. In July i had one of the main gear splines simply break off as i was cranking, raising the boat trailer . Ok, i thought , still functional with a little slip. October , broke another gear spline while leveling trailer .
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: easy install, looks great. i hope it holds up to the weather and water. its supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This Swivel Trailer Jack is sturdy. Perfect for my ATV trailer needs. Read and follow the directions.
customer_reviews.author: Uglystik

customer_reviews.title: Less than 5 minute install
customer_reviews.text: Used this on my trailer for a 12ft boat and it worked perfectly. Super easy installation that took less than 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: michael w

customer_reviews.title: I it's very useful
customer_reviews.text: It was very useful to me I have a lawn trailer and it works very good with it
customer_reviews.author: DAVIDCARROLL

customer_reviews.title: Good wheel but watch the size of trailer flange
customer_reviews.text: I would give a 5 but did not fit exactly to my trailer as expected. I added a thick wood sliver for a perfect fit. This item is very strong material and holds my trailer up.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph D. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The correct product delivered on time! Saves my back when attaching my trailer to my truck or ATV
customer_reviews.author: James Oswalt

customer_reviews.title: Pro Series 1000 Lbs
customer_reviews.text: Excellent works great and the price is right. I thought it would be a little flimsy but it seems to be well built. Would recommend !!!
customer_reviews.author: Fill W.

customer_reviews.title: No more strained back holding up the trailer tounge!
customer_reviews.text: Just what i ordered , good quality at an affordable price!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement - shipped and received as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install - make sure you grease the zerk fitting especially if you are using in salt water.
customer_reviews.author: WMaggio

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: A little awkward to install by one's self, but works smoothly and love the grease fitting. Replaced my old one with this and it rolls much easier. For some reason in the past 30 years the boat has gotten heavier????
customer_reviews.author: John R. Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: ☆☆☆☆☆
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what i wanted.Very well made.Worked perfect for my modified utility to boat trailer.
customer_reviews.author: JPC

customer_reviews.title: Hard installation
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Nice and sturdy. But I can't figure out how to install.
customer_reviews.author: LeRoy on Main Street

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Like grease fitting at top of jack. Jack swings up out of way for ease of travel. Makes boat and trailer easy to move about when not hooked to vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great jack
customer_reviews.text: This jack replaced an older jack on my trailer for a 17' Whaler. Of the 3 trailer jacks I have owned, this is by far the best. The handle is rubberized and beefy, rather than a hard black plastic tube that I am used to. The jack tube stays tight to the trailer and doesn't have any give as it takes the weight of the trailer. The wheel is the hard black plastic type. It's good for me in a gravel marina, but if your storage area is paved it's going to get beat up. I am very happy with this jack.
customer_reviews.author: Peter F. Gawne

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This tongue jack weighed 14.4# in its wrapping. The jack itself weighs 13.4#. Straight forward installation.
customer_reviews.author: Chekika

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Came in perfectly wrapped. It does take a little bit of assembly. Very simple. Looks very durable. Will be purchasing another for a car trailer. Very sarisfied!!!!
customer_reviews.author: james b

customer_reviews.title: It worked just fine
customer_reviews.text: It worked just fine, I am glad I bought the 1000 pound one because I don't always block the trailer wheels and that puts an extra load on the jack. It was easy to install and works well.
customer_reviews.author: akboy

customer_reviews.title: Easy replacement for a seadoo trailer
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with it and easy to replace old one.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what you would expect a trailer jack to do
customer_reviews.author: SomeCallMePotter

customer_reviews.title: Great communication. Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted. Fast delivery. Great communication. Good Price. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: 1000 # swivel Jack
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, but I will not have it installed until spring as it is 225 miles north at my closed-up cabin. To rate it properly I think it should be installed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Youngward

customer_reviews.title: Not too hot
customer_reviews.text: This was a waste of Money, I asked if it would work on my Ranger Bass, It didn't. I would look for a much heavier capacity, maybe a snowmobile trailer, this just doesn't cut it. It also ships from IBOATS, check there website first. Too heavy to return
customer_reviews.author: Carlton

customer_reviews.title: ... bit of time now and it has rusted out pretty terribly. I brought he replaced it and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this thing for a little bit of time now and it has rusted out pretty terribly. I brought he replaced it and it has been made six months.
customer_reviews.author: gordon freeman

customer_reviews.title: exactly what I ordered went together fast
customer_reviews.text: directions was not for that product but one like it. but product was what I needed. It came 2 days before it was supposed to. It was great because came before holiday .

customer_reviews.title: It jacks w/o issue and the nice this is it goes pretty high compared to my ...
customer_reviews.text: We installed this jack on a boat trailer in about 5 minutes. We have a 1000lb EZ Loader Trailer, with a 600lb boat. It jacks w/o issue and the nice this is it goes pretty high compared to my old jack.
customer_reviews.author: Curt S. Hayes

product_meta.title: Pro Series 1000 Lbs. Capacity Swivel Trailer Tongue Jack - EJ10000101
product_meta.description: Pro Series EJ1000 Trailer Jack is designed for use with marine and utility trailers. Pro Series brand tongue jacks are time-tested and application-proven. Features clear zinc finish for corrosion protection. Bolt-on, includes all necessary mounting hardware and 3/8" pull pin. Sturdy 6" Poly wheel. The Pro Series brand retaining ring swivel mount offers minimal deflection and maximum support. Mount fits up to a 3" x 5" trailer frame. Capacity: 1000 lbs., Travel: 10", Retracted Length: 13", Extended Length: 23" (Measured Center of Mount to Bottom of Wheel) Top Clearance: 11" (Measured Center of Mount to Top of Jack)
feature_bullets: Bolt-On Swivel Tongue Jack, 1000 lbs. capacity
Sturdy 6" Poly wheel, 3/8" swivel pull pin
Hardware included to mount up to a 3" x 5" trailer frame
Clear Zinc finish for corrosion protection
